Simulate clustered binary data for GMERT models

sim_data_gmert.Rd

Generates synthetic clustered data from a logistic mixed-effects model with random intercepts and random slopes. The simulated dataset is suitable for fitting and testing generalized mixed effects regression tree (GMERT) models.

Usage

sim_data_gmert(
  G = 50,
  n_i = 40,
  beta0 = 0.5,
  beta1 = 1.2,
  beta2 = -0.8,
  beta3 = 0.6,
  sigma_b0 = 0.8,
  sigma_b1 = 0.5,
  rho = 0.2,
  seed = 123
)

Arguments

G

Integer. Number of clusters.

n_i

Integer. Number of observations per cluster.

beta0

Numeric. Fixed intercept.

beta1

Numeric. Fixed effect for x1.

beta2

Numeric. Fixed effect for x2.

beta3

Numeric. Fixed effect for x3.

sigma_b0

Numeric. Standard deviation of the random intercept.

sigma_b1

Numeric. Standard deviation of the random slope for x1.

rho

Numeric. Correlation between random intercept and random slope.

seed

Integer. Random seed for reproducibility.

Value

A data.frame with columns id, y, x1, x2, and x3.

See also

fit_gmert, predict_gmert

Other gmert: fit_gmerf_small(), fit_gmert(), fit_gmert_small(), predict_gmert(), split_gmert_data()

Examples

data <- sim_data_gmert()
head(data)
#>   id y          x1         x2 x3
#> 1  1 1 -1.04509589  0.9159921  1
#> 2  1 1  1.84943575  0.8006224  1
#> 3  1 0  0.40546290 -0.9365690  0
#> 4  1 1  0.06011891 -1.4007874  1
#> 5  1 1 -0.38970663  0.1602775  1
#> 6  1 1  1.52098616 -0.2739624  0
